1.label: Remember device state
1.description:
This parameter determines how the device will react in the event of power supply failure (e.g. power outage). The parameter is not relevant for outputs set to pulse mode (parameter 150/151 set to 2).
		0 - remains switched off after restoring power
		1 - restores remembered state after restoring power

2.label: Overload safety switch
2.description:
This function allows to turn off the controlled device in case of exceeding the defined power. Controlled device can be turned back on via the button or sending a control frame.
		0 - function disabled
		10-5000 - (1.0-500.0W, step 0.1W) – power threshold

10.label: LED frame – power limit
10.description:
This parameter determines maximum active power. Exceeding it results in the LED frame flashing violet. Function is active only when parameter 11 is set to 8 or 9.
		100-5000 - (10.0-500.0W, step 0.1W) – power threshold

11.label: LED frame – colour when ON
11.description: This parameter defines the LED colour when thedevice is ON. When set to 8 or 9, LED frame colour will change depending on he measured power and parameter 10. Other colours are set permanently and do not depend on power consumption.

options.label: Colour changes smoothly depending on measured power
Colour changes in steps depending on measured power

12.label: LED frame – colour when OFF
12.description: This parameter defines the LED colour when the device is OFF.

13.label: LED frame – brightness
13.description:
This parameter allows to adjust the LED frame brightness.
		0 - LED disabled
		1-100 - (1-100% brightness)
		101 - brightness directly proportional to measured power
		102 - brightness inversely proportional asured powerto me

24.label: Buttons orientation
24.description: This parameter allows reversing the operation of the buttons.

30.label: Alarm configuration - 1st slot
30.description:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.
1B:  [MSB] Notification Type, 2B:  Notification Status, 3B: Event/State Parameters, 4B: [LSB] action
0xX0: no action on output, 0xX1: turn ON, 0xX2: turn OFF, 0xX3: turn ON/OFF continuously, 0x0X: no action on LED frame, 0x1X: LED frame blinks red, 0x2X: LED frame blinks green, 0x4X: LED frame blinks blue, 0x8X: disable LED frame, 0xFX: LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)

31.label: Alarm configuration - 2nd slot
31.description:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.
1B:  [MSB] Notification Type, 2B:  Notification Status, 3B: Event/State Parameters, 4B: [LSB] action
0xX0: no action on output, 0xX1: turn ON, 0xX2: turn OFF, 0xX3: turn ON/OFF continuously, 0x0X: no action on LED frame, 0x1X: LED frame blinks red, 0x2X: LED frame blinks green, 0x4X: LED frame blinks blue, 0x8X: disable LED frame, 0xFX: LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)

32.label: Alarm configuration - 3rd slot
32.description:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.
1B:  [MSB] Notification Type, 2B:  Notification Status, 3B: Event/State Parameters, 4B: [LSB] action
0xX0: no action on output, 0xX1: turn ON, 0xX2: turn OFF, 0xX3: turn ON/OFF continuously, 0x0X: no action on LED frame, 0x1X: LED frame blinks red, 0x2X: LED frame blinks green, 0x4X: LED frame blinks blue, 0x8X: disable LED frame, 0xFX: LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)

33.label: Alarm configuration - 4th slot
33.description:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.
1B:  [MSB] Notification Type, 2B:  Notification Status, 3B: Event/State Parameters, 4B: [LSB] action
0xX0: no action on output, 0xX1: turn ON, 0xX2: turn OFF, 0xX3: turn ON/OFF continuously, 0x0X: no action on LED frame, 0x1X: LED frame blinks red, 0x2X: LED frame blinks green, 0x4X: LED frame blinks blue, 0x8X: disable LED frame, 0xFX: LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)

34.label: Alarm configuration - 5th slot
34.description:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.
1B:  [MSB] Notification Type, 2B:  Notification Status, 3B: Event/State Parameters, 4B: [LSB] action
0xX0: no action on output, 0xX1: turn ON, 0xX2: turn OFF, 0xX3: turn ON/OFF continuously, 0x0X: no action on LED frame, 0x1X: LED frame blinks red, 0x2X: LED frame blinks green, 0x4X: LED frame blinks blue, 0x8X: disable LED frame, 0xFX: LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)

35.label: Alarm configuration – duration
35.description:
This parameter defines duration of alarm sequence.  When time set in this parameter elapses, alarm is cancelled, LED frame and relay restore normal operation, but do not recover state from before the alarm.
		0 - Infinite
		1-32400 - (1s-9h, 1s step) – Duration

40.label: First button – scenes sen
40.description:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent). Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learn mode by triple clicking.
				1 - Key pressed 1 time
				2 - Key pressed 2 time
				4 - Key pressed 3 time
				8 - Key hold down and key released

41.label: Second button – scenes sent
41.description:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent). Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learn mode by triple clicking.
		1 - Key pressed 1 time
		2 - Key pressed 2 time
		4 - Key pressed 3 time
		8 - Key hold down and key released

60.label: Power reports – include self-consumption
60.description: This parameter determines whether the power measurements should include power consumed by the device itself.

61.label: Power reports – on change
61.description:
This parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured power that results in sending new report. For loads under 50W the parameter is irrelevant, report are sent every 5W change.
		0 - Reporting on change disabled
		1-500 - (1-500%, 1% step) – Minimal change

62.label: Power reports – periodic
62.description:
This parameter defines reporting interval for measured power. Periodic reports are independent from changes in value (parameter 61).
		0 - periodic reports disabled
		30-32400 - (30s-9h, 1s step) – time interval

65.label: Energy reports – on change
65.description:
This parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured energy that results in sending new report.
		0 - reporting on change disabled
		1-500 - (0.01-5kWh, 0.01kWh step) – minimal change

66.label: Energy reports – periodic
66.description:
This parameter defines reporting interval for measured energy. Periodic reports are independent from changes in value (parameter 65).
		0 - periodic reports disabled
		30-32400 - (30s-9h, 1s step) – time interval

150.label: Minimum brightness level
150.description:
This parameter is set automatically during the calibration process, but can be changed manually after the calibration.
		1-98 - (1-98%, 1% step) – level of brightness

151.label: Maximum brightness level
151.description:
This parameter is set automatically during the calibration process, but can be changed manually after the calibration.
		2-99 - (2-99%, 1% step) – level of brightness

152.label: Incandescence level of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps
152.description:
The virtual value set as a percentage level between parameters MIN (1%) and MAX. (99%). The device will set to this value after the first switch on. It is required for warming up and switching dimmable compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources.
		1-99 - (1-98%, 1% step) – level of brightness

153.label: Incandescence time of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps
153.description:
This parameter determines the time required for switching compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Setting this parameter to 0 will disable the incandescence functionality.
		0-255 - (0-25.5s, 0.1s step) – incandescence time

154.label: Automatic control – dimming step size
154.description:
This parameter defines the percentage value of dimming step during the automatic control.
		0-99 - (1-99%, 1% step) – dimming step

155.label: Automatic control – time of dimming step
155.description:
This parameter defines the time of performing a single dimming step set in parameter 154 during the automatic control.
		0-255 - This parameter defines the time of performing a single dimming step set in parameter 154 during the automatic control.

156.label: Manual control – dimming step size
156.description:
This parameter defines the percentage value of the dimming step during the manual control.
		1-99 - (1-99%, 1% step) – dimming step

157.label: Manual control – time of dimming step
157.description:
This parameter defines the time of performing a single dimming step set in parameter 156 during the manual control.
		0-255 - (0-2.55s, 10ms step)

158.label: Auto-off functionality
158.description:
This parameter allows to automatically switch off the device after a specified time from switching the light source on. It may be useful when the device is installed in the stairway.
		0 - auto-off disabled
		1-32767 - (1s-9.1h, 1s step) – auto-off time

159.label: Force auto-calibration
159.description: Changing value of this parameter will force the calibration process. During the calibration parameter is set to 1 or 2 and switched to 0 upon completion.

160.label: Auto-calibration status (read-only parameter)
160.description: This parameter determines operating mode of the device (automatic/manual settings).

options.label: Calibration procedure not performed or the device operates on manual settings
The device operates on auto-calibration settings

161.label: Burnt out bulb detection
161.description:
This parameter defines percentage power variation (compared to power consumption measured during the calibration) to be interpreted as load error/burnt out bulb.
		0 - function disabled
		1-99 - (1-99%, 1% step) – power variation

162.label: Time delay of a burnt out bulb and overload detection
162.description:
This parameter defines detection delay for the burnt out bulb (parameter 161) and overload (parameter 2).
		0 - detection of a burnt out bulb disabled
		1-255 - (1-255s, 1s step) – time delay

163.label: First button – Switch ON value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
163.description:
This parameter defines value sent with Switch OFF command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.
		0-99 - value sent
		254 - send value equal to the current level
		255 - value sent

164.label: Second button – Switch OFF value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
164.description:
This parameter defines value sent with Switch ON command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.
		0-99 - value sent
		254 - send value equal to the current level
		255 - value sent

165.label: Double click – set level
165.description:
This parameter defines brightness level set after double-clicking any of the buttons. The same value is also sent to devices associated with 2nd and 3rd association group.
		0-99 - (0-99%, 1% step) – set level

170.label: Load control mode
170.description: This parameter allows to set the desired load control mode. Auto-calibration sets value of this parameter to 2 (control mode recognized during auto-calibration), but the installer may force control mode using this parameter. After changing parameter value, turn the load OFF and ON to change control mode.

options.label: Control mode selected automatically (based on auto-calibration)

171.label: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration (read only)
171.description: This parameter allows to read load control mode that was set during auto-calibration.

172.label: ON/OFF mode
172.description: This mode is necessary while connecting non-dimmable light sources. Setting this parameter to 1 automatically ignores brightening/dimming time settings. Forced auto-calibration will set this parameter’s value to 2.

options.label: ON/OFF mode enabled (dimming is not possible)

173.label: Dimmability of the load (read only)
173.description: This parameter allows to read if the load detected during calibration procedure is dimmable.

174.label: Soft-start functionality
174.description: This parameter allows to set time required to warm up the filament of halogen bulb.

175.label: Auto-calibration after power on
175.description: This parameter determines the trigger of auto-calibration procedure, e.g. power on, load error, etc.

options.label: Auto-calibration after each LOAD ERROR (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb), if parameter 176 is set to 1 also after SURGE (output overvoltage) and OVERCURRENT (output overcurrent)

Auto-calibration after each power on or after each LOAD ERROR (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb), if parameter 176 is set to 1 also after SURGE (output overvoltage) and OVERCURRENT (output overcurrent)

176.label: Behaviour after OVERCURRENT or SURGE
176.description: Error occurrences related to surge or overcurrent results in turning off the output to prevent possible malfunction. By default the device performs three attempts to turn on the load (useful in case of temporary, short failures of the power supply).

options.label: Device permanently disabled until re-enabling by command or external switch
Three attempts to turn on the load

177.label: Brightness level correction for flickering loads
177.description:
Correction reduces spontaneous flickering of some capacitive loads (e.g. dimmable LEDs) at certain brightness levels in 2-wire installation.
		In countries using ripple-control, correction may cause changes in brightness. In this case it is necessary to disable correction or adjust the time of correction for flickering loads.
		0 - automatic correction disabled
		1-254 - (1-254s, 1s step) – duration of correction
		255 - automatic correction always enabled

178.label: Method of calculating the active power
178.description: This parameter defines how to calculate active power. It is useful in a case of 2-wire connection with light sources other than resistive.

options.label: Measurement based on the standard algorithm
Approximation based on the calibration data
Approximation based on the control angle

179.label: Approximated power at the maximum brightness level
179.description:
This parameter determines the approximate value of the power that will be reported by the device at its maximum brightness level.
		0-500 - (0-500W, 1W step) – power consumed by the load at the maximum brightness level.
